Name: 0 Series Shinkansen Speed: 210km/h Model creation: 1964

History:


The 0 Series Shinkansen was created to connect major cities across Japan revolutionizing transportation in the country. The train's a streamlined design sets the standard for future high-speed rail developments worldwide

Facts:


The 0 Series Shinkansen, introduced in 1964, was Japan's first high-speed train. Capable of speeds up to 210 km/h, it revolutionized rail travel in Japan and set the standard for high-speed rail systems worldwide. The 0 Series features a distinctive streamlined design, providing a comfortable and efficient travel experience.
